-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckStoragePool'

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckStoragePool_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

16.description:
Critical threshold for StoragePool IsPowerProtected is, whether the disks in this pool are able to tolerate power loss without data loss.
For example, they automatically flush volatile buffers to non-volatile media after external power is disconnected.
16.caption: IsPowerProtectedCritical

7.description:
Used to specify a Warning threshold for the StoragePool FreeSpaces in GB. This value is a decreasing metric which will require
you to add a ':' behind the threshold, like '20GB:' to check if free space is lower compared to your threshold
7.caption: FreeSpaceWarning

5.description: With this parameter you can filter out which StoragePools you want to check, provided you have several StoragePools on your system.
5.caption: IncludeStoragePool

21.description:
A primordial pool, also known as the 'available storage' pool is where storage capacity is drawn and returned in the
creation and deletion of concrete storage pools. Primordial pools cannot be created or deleted. You can set this to
true if you also want to check Primordial StoragePools. Default to false.
21.caption: IncludePrimordial

18.description: Critical threshold for Health of StoragePool is whether or not the storage pool can maintain the required redundancy levels.
18.caption: HealthStatusCritical

12.description: Used to specify a Warning threshold for the StoragePool Capacity.
12.caption: CapacityWarning

10.description: Used to specify TotalUsed Critical threshold in GB.
10.caption: TotalUsedCritical

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

22.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin. Default to FALSE.
22.caption: NoPerfData

8.description:
Used to specify a Critical threshold for the StoragePool FreeSpaces in GB. This value is a decreasing metric which will require
you to add a ':' behind the threshold, like '20GB:' to check if free space is lower compared to your threshold
8.caption: FreeSpaceCritical

17.description: Warning threshold for Health of StoragePool is whether or not the storage pool can maintain the required redundancy levels.
17.caption: HealthStatusWarning

11.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold for the StoragePool IsReadOnly Attr.
11.caption: IsReadOnlyCritical

9.description: Used to specify TotalUsed Warning threshold in GB.
9.caption: TotalUsedWarning

14.description:
Critical threshold for StoragePool ClearOnDeallocate is, if physical disks should be zeroed (cleared of all data) when
unmapped or removed from the storage pool.
14.caption: ClearOnDeallocateCritical

20.description:
Critical threshold RetireMissingPhysicalDisks specifies whether the storage subsystem will automatically retire physical disks that are missing from this
storage pool and replace them with hot spares or other physical disks that are available in the storage pool.
20.caption: RetireMissingPhysicalDisksCritical

15.description: Critical threshold StoragePool SupportsDeduplication is, whether the storage pool supports data duplication or not.
15.caption: SupportsDeduplicationCritical

23.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
23.caption: Verbosity

6.description: With this parameter you can filter out which StoragePools you do not want to check, provided you have several StoragePools on your system.
6.caption: ExcludeStoragePool

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

19.description:
Warning threshold RetireMissingPhysicalDisks specifies whether the storage subsystem will automatically retire physical disks that are missing from this
storage pool and replace them with hot spares or other physical disks that are available in the storage pool.
19.caption: RetireMissingPhysicalDisksWarning

13.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold for the StoragePool Capacity.
13.caption: CapacityCritical
